text:
Hi, i've just installed Apache 2.0.43 on Windows XP(with Service Pack 1) and it 
dosen't want to work...
Once installed, i start Apache.exe with the params "-k install" and it installs 
the service, then i run the monitor and try to start the Apache Server and it 
tells me it cant... I also try to start the service manually, and it tells me 
it stopped and that may be caused by the service having nothing left to do...

my error.log contains the following
[Wed Jan 15 23:19:26 2003] [notice] Parent: Created child process 1624
[Wed Jan 15 23:19:28 2003] [notice] Child 1624: Child process is running
[Wed Jan 15 23:19:28 2003] [crit] (730045)The attempted operation is not 
supported for the type of object referenced.  : Parent: WSADuplicateSocket 
failed for socket 2523160. Check the FAQ.
[Wed Jan 15 23:19:28 2003] [crit] (730045)The attempted operation is not 
supported for the type of object referenced.  : master_main: create child 
process failed. Exiting.
[Wed Jan 15 23:19:28 2003] [crit] (720109)The pipe has been ended.  : 
setup_inherited_listeners: Unable to read socket data from parent
[Wed Jan 15 23:19:28 2003] [notice] Parent: Forcing termination of child 
process 2538416

I really hope there is a way to fix this, please help :)
creator: ampoz@hotmail.com
apachez@home.se
text:
Try this:

First of all check that there are no other services running on your port 
(default tcp 80, if not check your httpd.conf in case you changed this). Also 
disable IIS (or reconfigure to use another port) if you have that running, you 
can verify this by doing a "netstat -an" in the command console ("msdos 
prompt") or by telnetting yourself at the desired port like "telnet localhost 
80" and see if you get a prompt or not.

Login as Administrator, run the "apache -k install" and reboot the system.

Login as Administrator again and bring up the task manager (ctrl+shift+esc 
among other ways) and watch the process list to see if the Apache process is 
running.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
When a message suggests check the FAQ, it is a frequently asked question.
  Consult the appropriate user forum with such questions, or look for similar
  bug reports before filing a new bug.  The bug database is only for reporting
  errors in the Apache software.

  You have firewall or antivirus software interfering with the socket stack.

  See: http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/binaries/win32/
